18.22.2.text: Or, if hee may be profitable, doth his good successe depend thereon?

18.22.6.text: Heb. stripped the clothes of the naked.

18.22.8.text: Heb. eminent or accepted for countenance.

18.22.12.text: Heb. the head of the starres.

18.22.16.text: Heb. a flood was powred vpon their foundation.

18.22.29.text: Heb. him that hath lowe eyes.

18.22.30.text: Or, the innocent shall deliuer the Iland.

18.23.10.text: Heb. the way that is with me.

18.23.12.text: Hebr. I haue hid, or layd vp.

18.24.6.text: Hebr. the wicked gather the vintage.

18.24.15.text: Hebr setteth his face in secret.

18.24.22.text: Or. hee trusteth not his owne life.

18.26.10.text: Heb. vntill the end of light with darknesse.

18.27.3.text: That is, the breath which God gaue him.

18.27.22.text: Heb. in fleeing he would flee.

18.28.15.text: Heb. fine gold shall not be giuen for it.

18.29.10.text: Heb. the voice of the nobles was hid.

18.29.17.text: Heb. the iaw teeth or the grinders

18.30.1.text: Heb. of fewer dayes then I.

18.30.10.text: Heb. and withhold not spittle from my face.

18.30.21.text: Hebr. the strength of thy hand.

18.30.25.text: Heb. for him that was hard of day.

18.31.6.text: Hebr. let him weigh mee in balances of Iustice.

18.31.15.text: Or, did hee not fashion vs in one wombe?

18.31.27.text: Hebr. my hand hath kissed my mouth.

18.31.33.text: Or, after the manner of men.

18.31.35.text: Or, behold my signe is that the Almightie will answere mee.

18.31.39.text: Heb. caused the soule of the owners therof to expire, or breath out.

18.32.15.text: Heb. they remoued speeches from themselues.

18.32.18.text: Heb. the spirit of my belly.

18.33.6.text: Heb. cut out of the clay.

18.33.18.text: Heb. from passing by the sword.

18.33.27.text: Or, he shall looke vpon men, and say

18.33.28.text: Or, he hath deliuered my soule &c. and my life.

18.34.20.text: Heb. they shall take away the mighty.

18.34.26.text: Hebr. in the place of beholders.

18.34.33.text: Hebr. Should it be from with thee?

18.34.36.text: My father, let Iob be tried.

18.35.3.text: Or, by it more then by my sinne.

18.35.4.text: Heb. I wil returne to thee words.

18.36.2.text: Heb. that there are yet words for God.

18.36.12.text: Heb. they shall passe away by the sword.

18.36.16.text: Heb. the rest of thy table.

18.36.17.text: Or, iudgement and iustice should uphold thee.

18.37.6.text: Heb and to the shower of raine, and to the showers of raine of his strength.

18.38.10.text: Or, established my decree vpon it.

18.38.11.text: Heb. the pride of thy waues.

18.38.37.text: Heb. who can cause to lie downe.

18.38.38.text: Or, when the dust is turned into myre.

18.39.13.text: Or, the feathers of the storke and Ostrich.

18.40.15.text: Or, the Elephant, as some think.

18.40.24.text: Or, will any take him in his sight? or bore his nose with a ginne?

18.41.1.text: That is, a whale or a whirlepoole.

18.41.30.text: Heb. sharpe pieces, of the potsherd.

18.41.33.text: Or who behaue themselues without feare.

18.42.2.text: Or, no thought of thine can be hindred.

18.42.10.text: Heb. added to Iob vnto the double.

19.2.6.text: Hebr. vpon Sion, the hill of my Holinesse.

19.5.6.text: Heb. the man of bloods and deceit.

19.5.7.text: Heb. the temple of thy holinesse.

19.5.9.text: Heb. in his mouth .i. in the mouth of any of them.

19.5.11.text: Heb. thou couerest, ouer, or protectest them.

19.7.10.text: Heb. my buckler is vpon God.

19.7.15.text: Heb. hee hath digged a pit.

19.8.7.text: Heb. flocks and oxen, all of them.

19.9.4.text: Hebr. thou hast made my iudgement.

19.9.6.text: Or, the destructions of the enemy are come to a perpetuall end: and their cities hast thou destroyed, &c.

19.10.2.text: Heb. in the pride of the wicked be doth persecute.

19.10.3.text: Or, the covetous blesseth himself, he abhorreth the Lord.

19.10.4.text: Or, all his thoughts are there is no God.

19.12.2.text: Hebr. an heart, and an heart.

19.12.8.text: Hebr. the vilest of the sonnes of men are exalted.

19.17.7.text: Or, that sauest them which trust in thee from these that rise vp against thy right hand.

19.17.9.text: Heb. my enemies against the soule.

19.17.12.text: Heb. the likeness of him (i. of euery one of them) is as a lion that desireth to rauin.

19.18.35.text: Or, with thy meekenesse thou hast multiplied me.

19.18.44.text: Heb. at the hearing of the eare.
Heb. the sonnes of the stranger.
Or, yeeld fained obedience. Heb. lie.

19.19.3.text: Or, without these their voyce is heard.

19.19.10.text: Hebr. the dropping of hony combes.

19.20.1.text: Hebr. set thee on an high place.

19.20.3.text: Heb. turne to ashes: or, make fat.

19.20.6.text: Hebr. from the heauen of his holinesse.
Hebr. by the strength of the saluation of his right hand.

19.21.6.text: Hebr set him to be blessings.

19.21.12.text: Or, thou shalt set them as a butte.

19.22.2.text: Heb. there is no silence to me.

19.22.8.text: Heb. hee rolled himselfe on the Lord.
Or, if he delight in him.

19.22.13.text: Heb. opened their mouthes against me.

19.25.14.text: Or, and his couenant to make them know it.

19.26.8.text: Heb. of the Tabernacle of thy honor.

19.27.8.text: Or, my heart seek vnto thee, let my face seeke thy face &c.

19.28.2.text: Or, towards the Oracle of thy Sanctuary.

19.29.1.text: Hebr. yee sonnes of the mighty.

19.29.2.text: Hebr. the honour of his name.

19.29.9.text: Or, euery whit of it vttereth &c.

19.30.5.text: Heb. there is but a moment in his anger.

19.30.7.text: Hebr. setled strength for my mountaine.

19.30.12.text: That is, my tongue, or my soule.

19.31.2.text: Heb. to me for a rocke of strength.

19.31.17.text: Or, let them be cast off for the graue.

19.32.6.text: Heb. in a time of finding.

19.32.8.text: Heb. I will counsel thee, mine eye shall be vpon thee.

19.34.18.text: Heb. to the broken of heart.

19.35.8.text: He. which he knoweth not of.

19.35.14.text: Heb. as a friend, as a brother to me.

19.36.2.text: Heb. to find his iniquitie to hate.

19.37.5.text: Heb. rolle thy way vpon the Lord.

19.37.7.text: Hebr. be silent to the LORD.

19.37.35.text: Or, a greeve tree, that groweth him owne soyle.

19.38.15.text: Or, thee do I wast for.

19.39.1.text: Heb. a bridle, or mousell for my mouth.

19.39.4.text: Or, what time I haue here.

19.39.11.text: Heb. that which is to be desired in him, to melt away.

19.40.5.text: Or, none can order them vnto thee.

19.40.8.text: Heb. in the midst of my bowels.

19.41.1.text: Heb. in the day of euill.

19.41.9.text: Heb. the man of my peace.

19.43.1.text: Hebr. from a man of deceit, and iniquitie.

19.43.4.text: Hebr the gladnesse of my ioy.

19.46.2.text: Hebr. the heart of the seas.

19.46.7.text: Heb. an high place for vs.

19.47.7.text: Or, euery one that hath vnderstanding.

19.47.9.text: Or, the voluntarie of the people are gathered vnto the people of the God of Abraham.

19.48.13.text: Heb. set your heart to her bulwarkes.

19.49.14.text: Or, the graue being an habitation to euery one of them.

19.49.15.text: Heb. from the hand of the graue.

19.50.18.text: Hebr. thy portion was with adulterers.

19.51.16.text: Or, that I should giue it.

19.55.13.text: Heb. a man according to my ranke.

19.55.19.text: Or, with whom also there be no changes yet they feare not God.

19.55.23.text: Heb. men of bloods and deceit.
Hebr. shal not halfe their dayes.

19.57.3.text: Or, he reproacheth him that would swallow me vp.

19.58.5.text: Or, be the charmest neuer so cunning.

19.59.15.text: Or, if they be not satisfied, then they will stay all night.

19.60.8.text: Or, triumph thou ouer me. [by an ironie].

19.61.6.text: Hebr. thou shalt adde dayes to the dayes of the King.

19.63.10.text: Hebr. they shall make him run out like water by the hands of the sword.

19.64.6.text: Or, we are confirmed by that which they haue throughly searched.

19.65.3.text: Heb. words or matters of iniquities.

19.65.9.text: Or, after thou hadst made it to desire raine.

19.65.10.text: Or, thou causest raine to descend into the furrowes thereof.

19.65.11.text: Heb. the yeere of thy goodnesse.

19.66.3.text: Or, yeild fained obedience. Heb. lie.

19.68.26.text: Or, ye that are of the fountaine of Israel.

19.68.30.text: Or, the beast of the reeds.

19.69.17.text: Heb. make haste to heare me.

19.69.25.text: Hebr. let there not bee a dweller.

19.71.3.text: Hebr. be thou to me for a rocke of habitation

19.71.18.text: Hebr. vnto old age, and gray haires.

19.71.22.text: Hebr. with the instrument of psalterie.

19.72.7.text: Hebr. till there be no moone.

19.72.17.text: Heb. shalbe as a sonne to continue his fathers name for euer.

19.73.5.text: Heb. in the trouble of other men.

19.73.7.text: Heb. they passe the thoughts of the heart.

19.73.16.text: Heb. it was labour in mine eies.

19.74.7.text: Hebr. they bene sent thy Sanctuarie into the fire.

19.75.2.text: Or, when I shall take a set time.

19.77.17.text: Heb. the clouds were powred forth with water.

19.78.8.text: Hebr. that prepared not their heart.

19.78.25.text: Or, euery one did eat the bread of the mighty.

19.78.50.text: Or, their beasts, to the murreine

19.79.8.text: Or, the iniquities of them that were before vs.

19.79.11.text: Hebr. reserue the children of death.

19.80.2.text: Heb. come for saluation to vs.

19.81.12.text: Or, to the hardnes of their hearts, or imagination.

19.81.15.text: Or, yeelded fained obedience. Heb. lyed.

19.81.16.text: Hebr. with the fat of wheat.

19.83.8.text: Hebr. they haue bene an arme to the children of Lot.

19.84.6.text: Or, of mulbery-trees make him a well &c.

19.84.10.text: Heb. I would choose rather to sit at the threshold.

19.85.3.text: Or, thou hast turned thine anger from waxing hot.

19.89.10.text: Heb. with the arme of thy strength.

19.89.18.text: Or, our shield is of the LORD, and our king is of the holy One of Israel.

19.89.33.text: Heb. I will not make voyd from him.

19.90.4.text: Or, when he hath passed them.

19.90.10.text: Hebr. as for the dayes of our yeeres, in them are seuentie yeeres.

19.92.3.text: Or, vpon the solemne sound with the harpe. Hebr. Higgaion.

19.95.4.text: Or, the heightes of the hilles, are his.

19.95.11.text: Heb. if they enter into my rest.

19.103.11.text: Heb. according to the height of the heauen.

19.104.5.text: Hebr. he hath founded the earth vpon her bases.

19.104.8.text: Or, the mountaines ascend, the valleys descend.

19.104.15.text: Hebr. to make his face shine with oyle, or more then oyle.

19.104.20.text: Heb. all the beasts thereof doe trample on the forrest.

19.105.18.text: Heb. his soule came into yron.

19.105.32.text: Hebr. he gaue their raine, haile.

19.106.13.text: Heb. they made haste, they forgate.

19.107.27.text: Heb. all their wisedome is swallowed vp.

19.109.7.text: Hebr. goe out guiltie, or wicked.

19.109.31.text: Heb. from the iudges of his soule.

19.110.3.text: Or, more then the wombe of the morning: thou shalt haue, &c.

19.113.9.text: Heb. to dwell in an house.

19.118.23.text: Heb. this is from the LORD.

19.119.42.text: Or, so shall I answere him that reproueth me in a thing.

19.119.98.text: Heb. it is euer with me.

19.119.132.text: Hebr according to the custome towards those, &c.

19.119.160.text: Heb. the beginning of thy word is true.

19.119.165.text: Heb. they shall haue no stumbling blocke

19.120.3.text: Or, what shall the deceitfull tongue giue vnto thee? or what shall it profit thee?

19.120.4.text: It is as the sharpe arrowes of the mighty man with coales of iuniper.

19.121.1.text: Or, shall I lift vp mine eies to the hils? whence should my helpe come?

19.126.1.text: Hebr. returned the returning of Zion.

19.126.2.text: Hebr. hath magnified to doe with them.

19.127.1.text: Hebr. are builders of it in it.

19.127.5.text: Hebr. hath filled his quiuer with them.
Or, shall subdue, as Psal.18.45. or, destroy.

19.130.6.text: Or, which watch vnto the morning.

19.136.8.text: Heb. for the rulings by day.

19.137.3.text: Heb. the words of a song.

19.137.6.text: Heb. the head of my ioy.

19.137.8.text: Heb. that recompenseth vnto thee thy deed which thou didst to vs.

19.139.12.text: Heb. as is the darkenes so is the light

19.139.16.text: Or, what dayes they should be fashioned.

19.139.24.text: Heb. way of paine, or griefe.

19.140.8.text: Or, let them not be exalted.

19.140.11.text: Heb. a man of tongue: or, an euill speaker, a wicked man of violence be established in the earth: let him be hunted to his ouerthrow.

19.141.5.text: Or, let the righteous smite mee kindly, and reproue me, let not their precious oile breake my head, &c.

19.141.8.text: Heb. make not my soule bare.

19.142.4.text: Looke on the right hand, and see.
Hebr. no man sought after my soule.

19.143.7.text: Or, for I am become like. &c.

19.144.14.text: Heb. able to beare burdens, or loaden with flesh.

19.145.3.text: Heb. and of his greatnesse there is no search.

19.145.13.text: Hebr. a kingdome of all ages.

19.147.5.text: Heb. of his vnderstanding there is no number.

19.147.14.text: Heb. who maketh thy border peace

20.1.17.text: Hebr. in the eyes of euery thing that hath a wing.

20.1.20.text: Hebr. wisedomes, that is, excellent wisedome.

20.3.13.text: Hebr. the man that draweth out vnderstanding.

20.4.9.text: Or, shee shall compasse thee with a crowne of glory.

20.4.24.text: Heb. frowardnesse of mouth and peruersnes of lips.

20.4.26.text: Or, all thy wayes shalbe ordered aright.

20.5.19.text: Heb. erre thou alwayes in her loue.

20.6.3.text: Or, so shalt thou preuaile with thy friend.

20.6.26.text: Heb. the woman of a man, or a mans wife.

20.6.35.text: Hebr. he will not accept the face of any ransome.

20.7.9.text: Heb. in the euening of the day.

20.7.13.text: Heb. shee strengthened her face and sayd.

20.7.14.text: Heb. peace offerings are vpon me.

20.8.7.text: Heb. the abomination of my lips.

20.10.3.text: Or, the wicked for their wickednesse.

20.11.13.text: Heb. hee that walketh being a talebearer.

20.12.13.text: Heb. the snare of the wicked is in the transgression of lippes.

20.14.10.text: Heb. the bitternesse of his soule.

20.14.20.text: Heb. many are the louers of the rich.

20.15.4.text: Hebr. the healing of the tongue.

20.15.19.text: Hebr. is raised vp as a causey.

20.16.20.text: Or, he that vnderstandeth a matter.

20.16.26.text: Heb. the soule of him that laboureth.

20.17.10.text: Or, a reproofe aweth more a wise man, then to strike a foole an hundred times.

20.18.1.text: Or, he that separateth himselfe, seeketh according to his desire, and intermedleth in euery businesse.

20.18.8.text: Or, like as when men are wounded

20.19.18.text: Or, to his destruction: or, to cause him to die.

20.20.10.text: Hebr. a stone, and a stone.
Hebr. an ephah, and an ephah.

20.20.17.text: Heb. bread of lying, or falshood.

20.20.30.text: Hebr. is a purging medicine against euill.

20.21.4.text: Or, the light of the wicked.

20.21.7.text: Heb. saw them, or, dwell with them.

20.21.19.text: Heb. in the land of the desert.

20.21.24.text: Heb. in the wrath of pride.

20.22.7.text: Heb. to the man that lendeth.

20.22.8.text: Or, and with the rod of his anger he shalbe consumed.

20.22.11.text: Or, and hath grace in his lips.

20.22.21.text: Or, to those that send thee.

20.23.5.text: Heb. wilt thou cause thine eyes to fly vpon?

20.23.34.text: Heb. in the heart of the sea.

20.24.18.text: Heb. it be euill in his eyes.

20.24.19.text: Or, keepe not company with the wicked.

20.25.6.text: Hebr. set not out thy glory.

20.25.9.text: Or, discouer not the secret of another.

20.25.14.text: Hebr. in a gift of falshood.

20.25.17.text: Or, let thy foote be seldome in thy neighbours house.

20.25.23.text: The Northwinde bringeth foorth raine, so doeth a backbiting tongue, an angry countenance.

20.26.8.text: Or, as he that putteth a pretious stone in an heape of stones.

20.26.10.text: Or, a great man grieueth all, and hee hireth the foole, he hireth also transgressors.

20.26.26.text: Or, hatred is couered in secret.

20.27.4.text: Heb. wrath is crueltie, and anger an ouerflowing.

20.27.9.text: Heb. from the counsell of the soule.

20.28.2.text: Or, by men of vnderstanding and wisedome shall they likewise be prolonged.

20.28.22.text: Or, he that hath an euill eye, hasteth to be rich, ver, 20.

20.29.8.text: Or, set a citie on fire.

20.29.26.text: Hebr. the face of a ruler.

20.30.10.text: Heb. hurt not with thy tongue.

20.30.31.text: Or, horse. Heb. girt in the loynes.

20.31.5.text: Hebr. of all the sonnes of affliction.

21.2.3.text: Hebr. to draw my flesh with wine.
Hebr. the number of the dayes of their life.

21.2.12.text: Or, in those things which haue bene already done.

21.2.13.text: Hebr. That there is an excellencie in Wisedome more then in folly,&c.

21.2.15.text: Hebr. happeneth to me, euen to me.

21.3.15.text: Heb. that which is driuen away.

21.3.18.text: Or, that they might deare God, and see, &c.

21.3.21.text: Heb. of the sons of man.

21.4.4.text: Heb. all the rightnes of worke.
Heb. this is the enuie of a man from his neighbour.

21.4.13.text: Heb. who knoweth not to be admonished.

21.5.8.text: Heb. at the will or purpose.

21.5.18.text: Heb. there is a good which is comely, &c.
Heb. the number of the dayes.

21.5.20.text: Or, though he giue not much, yet he remembred &c.

21.6.9.text: Heb. then the walking of the soule.

21.6.12.text: Heb. the number of the dayes of the life of his vanitie.

21.7.11.text: Or, as good as an inheritance, yea, better too.

21.7.25.text: Heb. I and mine heart compassed.

21.7.26.text: He that is good before God.

21.7.27.text: Or, weighing one thing after another to finde out the reason.

21.9.1.text: Hebr. I gaue, or set to my heart.

21.10.11.text: Heb. the master of the tongue.

21.11.1.text: Heb. vpon the face of the waters.

21.12.3.text: Or, the grinders faile, because they grind litle.

21.12.9.text: Or, the more wise the Preacher was, &c. , 1.King.4. 32.

21.12.13.text: Or, the end of the matter, euen all that hath bene heard, is.

22.1.7.text: Or, as one that is vailed.

22.2.3.text: Heb. I delighted and sate downe, &c.

22.5.1.text: Or, and be drunken with loues.

22.5.12.text: Heb sitting in fulnesse, that is fitly placed, and set as a precious stone in the foile of a ring.

22.6.5.text: Or, they haue puffed me vp.

22.6.12.text: Or, set me on the chariot of my willing people.

22.8.1.text: Hebr. they should not despise me.

22.8.4.text: Heb. why should yee stirre vp, or why,&c?

23.1.7.text: Heb. as the ouerthrow of strangers.

23.1.27.text: Or, they that returne of her.

23.2.18.text: Or, the idoles shall vtterly passe away.

23.2.20.text: Hebr. the idols of his siluer,&c.
Or, which they made for him.

23.3.3.text: Hebr. A man eminent in countenance.

23.3.12.text: Or, they which call thee blessed.

23.4.1.text: Heb. let thy name be called vpon vs.

23.4.2.text: Heb. for the escaping of Israel.

23.5.1.text: Heb. the horne of the sonne of oyle.

23.5.2.text: Or, made a wall about it.

23.5.9.text: Or, this is in mine eares saith the LORD, &c.

23.5.13.text: Heb. their glory are men of famine.

23.5.16.text: Or, the holy God. Heb. The God the holy.

23.5.30.text: Or, when it is light it shalbe darke in the destructions thereof.

23.6.3.text: Heb. his glory is the fulnesse of the whole earth.

23.6.6.text: Heb. and in his hand a liue-coale.

23.6.9.text: Or, without ceasing, &c. Heb. heare yee in hearing, &c.

23.6.13.text: Or, when it is returned and hath bin broused.

23.7.3.text: That is, the remnant shal returne. , 2.kings. 18.17.

23.7.4.text: Heb. let not thy heart be tender.

23.7.9.text: Or, doe yee not beleeue? it is because yee are not stable.

23.7.10.text: Heb. and the Lord added to speak.

23.7.22.text: Hebr. in the midst of the land.

23.8.1.text: Hebr. In making speed to the spoile, he hasteneth the pray. Or, make speed, &c.

23.8.4.text: He that is before the King of Assyria shall take away the riches &c.

23.8.8.text: Hebr. The fulnesse of the breadth of thy land shall be the stretching out of his wings.

23.9.5.text: Or, when the whole battell of the warriour was, &c.

23.9.16.text: Or, they that call them blessed.
Or, they that are called blessed of them.

23.10.1.text: Or, to the writers that write grieuousnesse.

23.10.6.text: Heb. to lay them a treading.

23.10.12.text: Heb. of the greatnesse of the heart.

23.10.15.text: Or, as if a rod should shake them that lift it vp.
Or, that which is not wood.

23.10.18.text: Heb. from the soule and euen to the flesh.

23.10.24.text: Or, but hee shall lift vp his staffe for thee.

23.10.30.text: Heb. crie shrill with thy voice.

23.11.14.text: Heb. the children of the East.
Heb. Edom and Moab shall be the laying on of their hand.
Heb. the children of Ammon their obedience.

23.13.8.text: Heb. euery man at his neighbour.

23.14.2.text: Hebr. that had taken them captiues.

23.14.17.text: Did not let his prisoners loose homeward.

23.14.31.text: Or, he shall not be alone.

23.15.3.text: Heb. descending into weeping: or, comming downe with weeping.

23.15.5.text: Or, to the borders thereof euen to Zoar as an heifer.

23.16.9.text: Or, the alarme is fallen vpon, &c.

23.17.11.text: Or, remoued in the day of inheritance, and there shalbe deadly sorrow.

23.18.2.text: Or, a nation that meteth out, and treadeth downe. Heb. a nation of line line, and treading vnderfoote.
Or, whose land the riuers despise.

23.19.18.text: Or, of Heres: or of the Sunne.

23.20.2.text: Heb. by the hand of Isaiah.

23.21.15.text: Or, for feare. Heb. from the face.

23.22.4.text: Heb. I will be bitter in weeping.

23.22.7.text: Heb. the choice of the valleys.

23.22.17.text: Or, the Lord who couered thee with an excellent couering, and clothed thee gorgeously, v. 18. shall surely, &c.
Heb. the captiuitie of a man.

23.23.11.text: Or, concerning a merchant man. Heb. Canaan.

23.23.15.text: Heb. it shal be vnto Tyre as the song of an harlot.

23.24.4.text: Heb. the height of the people.

23.24.16.text: Heb. leannesse to me or my secret to me.

23.24.22.text: Heb. with the gathering of prisoners.

23.24.23.text: Or, there shalbe glory before his ancients.

23.27.7.text: Heb. according to the stroke of those.

23.27.8.text: Or, when thou sendest it foorth.

23.28.18.text: Heb. a treading downe to it.

23.28.19.text: Or, when he shall make you to vnderstand doctrine.

23.28.25.text: Or, the wheat in the principall place and barley in the appointed place.

23.28.26.text: Or, and he bindeth it in such sort as God doth teach him.

23.29.1.text: Or, oh Ariel that is the lyon of God: Or, of the citie.

23.29.9.text: Or, take your pleasure and riot.

23.30.17.text: Or, a tree bereft of branches, or boughes, or a maste.

23.30.22.text: Hebr. the grauen images of thy siluer.

23.30.27.text: Or, and the grieuousnes of flame.

23.30.30.text: Hebr. the glory of his voice.

23.30.32.text: Hebr. euery passing of the rod founded.
Hebr cause to rest vpon him.

23.31.7.text: Heb. the idoles of his golde.

23.31.8.text: Or, for feare of the sword.
Or, tributarie: hebr. for melting, or tribute.

23.31.9.text: Or, his strength: heb. rocke shall passe away for feare.

23.32.7.text: Or, when he speaketh against the poore in iudgement.

23.32.19.text: Or, and the citie shall be vtterly abased.

23.33.17.text: Heb the land of farre distances.

23.33.21.text: Heb. broad of spaces or hands.

23.33.23.text: Or, they haue forsaken thy tacklings.

23.34.13.text: Or, ostriches. Hebr. daughters of the owle.

23.35.6.text: Matth.11 5. and 15. 30. and 21. 14. ioh. 5.8, 9 acts 3.2. and 8.7 and 14.8.

23.35.8.text: Or, for he shalbe with them.

23.36.5.text: Or, but counsell and strength are for the war.

23.36.16.text: Or, seeke my fauour by a present. Heb. make with me a blessing.

23.37.7.text: Or, put a spirit into him.

23.37.24.text: Heb. by the hand of thy seruants.
Heb. the tallnesse of the cedars thereof, and the choise of the firre trees thereof.
Or, the forrest and his fruitfull field.

23.37.26.text: Hast thou not heard how I haue made it long agoe, and formed it of ancient times? Should I now bring it to be laide waste, and defenced cities to be ruinous heapes?

23.37.31.text: Heb the escaping of the house of Iudah that remaineth.

23.38.1.text: Hebr. giue charge concerning thy house.

23.38.8.text: Hebr. degrees by, or with the Sunne.

23.38.17.text: Or, on my peace came great bitternesse.
Hebr. thou hast loued me from the pit.

23.39.2.text: Or, iewels. heb. vessels or instruments.

23.40.9.text: O thou that tellest good tidings to Zion.
O thou that tellest good tidings to Ierusalem.

23.41.7.text: Or, saying of the soder, it is good.

23.41.11.text: Heb. the men of thy strife.

23.41.12.text: Heb. the men of thy contention.
Heb. the men of thy warre.

23.41.22.text: Heb. set our heart vpon them.

23.41.24.text: Or, worse then of a viper.

23.42.22.text: Or, in snaring all the yong men of them.

23.43.20.text: Or, ostriches. Hebr. daughters of the owle.

23.43.24.text: Heb. made me drunke: or, abundantly moistened.

23.44.19.text: Heb. that which comes of a tree.

23.45.24.text: Or, surely he shall say of me
In the Lord is all righteousnes and strength. Hebr. righteousnesses.

23.46.11.text: Hebr. the man of my counsel.

23.47.10.text: Or, caused thee to turne away.

23.47.13.text: Heb. that giue knowledge concerning the moneths.

23.48.13.text: Or, the palme of my right hand hath spread out.

23.49.5.text: Or, that Israel may be gathered to him, and I may &c.

23.49.6.text: Or, art thou lighter, then that thou shouldest &c.

23.49.7.text: Or, to him that is despised in soule.

23.49.24.text: Hebr. the captiuitie of the iust.

23.50.8.text: Heb. the master of my cause.

23.53.3.text: Or, he hid as it were his face from vs. Heb. as a hiding of faces from him or from vs.

23.53.6.text: Heb. hee hath made the iniquitie of vs all to meete on him.

23.53.8.text: Or, he was taken away by distresse and iudgement: but &c.
Heb. was the stroke vpon him.

23.53.10.text: Or, when his soule shall make an offring.

23.55.7.text: Heb. he wil multiplie to pardon.

23.56.10.text: Or, dreaming or talking in their sleepe.

23.56.11.text: Heb. Know not to be satisfied.

23.57.1.text: Hebr. men of kindnesse or godlinesse.
Or, from that which is euill.

23.57.8.text: Or, hewed it for thy selfe larger then theirs.

23.58.3.text: Or, things wherewith ye grieue others. Heb. griefes.

23.58.4.text: Or, ye fast not as this day.

23.58.5.text: Or, to afflict his soule for a day?

23.58.6.text: Heb. the bundles of the yoke.

23.59.5.text: Or, that which is sprinkled is as if there brake out a viper.

23.59.15.text: Heb. it was euill in his eyes.

23.60.1.text: Or, be enlightened: for thy light commeth.

23.60.5.text: Or, noise of the Sea shalbe turned toward thee.

23.62.4.text: That is, my delight is in her.

23.62.5.text: Hebr. with the ioy of the bridegrome.

23.62.6.text: Or, ye that are the Lords remembrancers.

23.63.16.text: Or, our redeemer, from euerlasting is thy name.

23.63.19.text: Heb. thy name was not called vpon them.

23.64.4.text: Or, seene a God besides thee which doeth so for him, &c.

23.65.17.text: Heb. come vp on the heart.

23.65.22.text: Heb. shall make them continue long, or shall weare out.

23.66.23.text: Heb. from new Moone to his new Moone, and from Sabbath to his Sabbath.

24.1.13.text: Heb. from the face of the North.

24.2.16.text: Or, feede on thy crown, deut. 33.12 Isai. 8.8.

24.2.24.text: Heb. the desire of her heart.

24.2.27.text: Heb. the hinder part part of the necke.

24.3.16.text: Heb. come vp on the heart.

24.3.18.text: Or, caused your fathers to possesse.

24.4.12.text: Or, a fuller winde then those.

24.4.19.text: Hebr. the walles of my heart.

24.5.26.text: Or, they pry as foulers lie in waite.

24.6.6.text: Or, powre out the engine of shot.

24.7.18.text: Or, frame, or workmanship of heauen.

24.7.31.text: Heb. came it vpon my heart.

24.8.9.text: Heb. the wisedome of what thing.

24.8.19.text: Heb. because of the countrey of them that are farre off.

24.9.8.text: Heb. in the middest of him.

24.9.10.text: Heb. from the foule euen to &c.

24.9.26.text: Hebr. cut off into corners, or hauing the corners of their haire polled.

24.10.8.text: Heb. in one, or at once.

24.10.14.text: Or, is more brutish, then to know.

24.11.19.text: Heb. the stalke with his bread.

24.12.6.text: Or, they cryed after thee fully.

24.12.8.text: Or, yelleth. Heb. giueth out his voice.

24.14.9.text: Hebr. thy Name is called vpon vs.

24.14.18.text: Or, make merchandise against a land, and men acknowledge it not

24.15.4.text: Hebr. I wil giue them for a moouing.

24.15.5.text: Hebr. to aske of thy thy peace.

24.27.15.text: Heb. in a lie, or lyingly.

24.34.15.text: Heb. wherupon my name is called.

24.35.19.text: Heb. there shall not a man be cut off from, &c.

24.40.14.text: Heb. to strike thee in soule?

24.42.20.text: Or, you haue vsed deceit against your soules.

24.44.28.text: Heb. from me or from them.

24.48.30.text: Or, those on whom hee stayeth (heb. his barres) do not right.

24.49.32.text: Heb. cut off into corners, or that haue the corners of their haire polled.

24.51.59.text: Or, prince of Menucha or chiefe chamberlaine.

24.52.25.text: Heb. saw the face of the king.

24.52.34.text: Heb. the matter of the day in his day.

25.1.8.text: Heb. is become a remouing or wandering.

25.1.11.text: Or, to make the soule to come againe.

25.1.15.text: Or, the winepresse of the virgine, &c.

25.3.16.text: Or, rolled me in the ashes.

25.3.21.text: Heb. make to returne to my heart.

25.4.14.text: Or, in that they could not but touch.

25.4.22.text: Or, carie thee captiue for thy sinnes

25.5.5.text: Heb. on our necks are we persecuted.

25.5.16.text: Hebr. the crowne of our head is fallen.

25.5.22.text: Or, for wilt thou vtterly reiect vs?

26.3.5.text: Heb. deepe of lippes and heauie of tongue, and so ver. 6.

26.3.6.text: Heb. deepe of lip, and heauie language.

26.3.7.text: Heb. stiffe of forhead and hard of heart.

26.4.3.text: Or, a flat plate, or slice.

26.4.6.text: Hebr. a day for a yeere, a day for a yeere.

26.4.8.text: Hebr. from thy side to thy side.

26.6.4.text: Or, sunne images, and so vers. 6.

26.7.11.text: Or, their tumultuous persons. Hebr. tumult.

26.7.13.text: Heb. thogh their life were yet among the liuing.

26.7.20.text: Or, made it vnto them an vncleane thing.

26.7.24.text: Or, they shall inherit their holy places.

26.8.17.text: Or is there any thing lighter than to commit?

26.12.4.text: Heb. as the goings foorth of captiuity.

26.12.11.text: Heb. by remouing goe into captiuitie.

26.13.2.text: Heb. them that are prophets out of their owne hearts.

26.13.22.text: Or, that I should saue his life. Hebr. by quickning him.

26.14.16.text: Hebr. in the midst of it.

26.16.4.text: Or, when I looked vpon thee.

26.16.31.text: Or, in thy daughters is thine &c.

26.16.47.text: Or, that was lothed as a small thing.

26.16.56.text: Heb. for a report or hearing.

26.17.13.text: Hebr. brought him to an oath.

26.17.14.text: Hebr. to keepe his couenant to stand to it.

26.18.10.text: Or, breaker vp of an house.

26.18.16.text: Heb. hath not pledged the pledge or taken to pledge.

26.19.10.text: Or, in thy quietnesse or in thy likenesse.

26.20.29.text: I told them what the hie place was, or Bamah.

26.21.16.text: Heb. set thy selfe, take the left hand.

26.21.23.text: Or, for the oathes made vnto them.

26.21.27.text: Heb. peruerted, peruerted, peruerted will I make it.

26.21.30.text: Or, cause to it to returne.

26.22.5.text: Heb. polluted of name, much in vexation.

26.23.7.text: Heb. bestowed her whoredomes vpon them.

26.23.11.text: Heb. she corrupted her inordinate loue more then &c.
Heb. more then the whoredomes of her sister.

26.23.16.text: Hebr. at the sight of her eyes.

26.23.42.text: Heb. of the multitude of men.

26.23.46.text: Heb. for a remoouing and spoyle.

26.24.17.text: Heb. vpper lip. And so vers.22.

26.24.21.text: Heb. the pitie of your soule.

26.24.25.text: Heb. the lifting vp of the soule.

26.25.10.text: Or, against the children of Ammon.

26.25.13.text: Or, they shall fall by the sword vnto Dedan.

26.26.8.text: Or, powre out the engine of shot.

26.26.10.text: Hebr. according to the entrings of a city broken vp.

26.27.9.text: Or, stoppers of chinks. Heb. strengthners.

26.27.21.text: Heb. they were the merchants of thy hand.

26.27.36.text: Heb. shalt not be for euer.

26.28.5.text: Heb. by the greatnesse of thy wisedome.

26.29.19.text: Heb. spoile her spoile and pray her pray.

26.32.6.text: Or, the land of thy swimming.

26.32.8.text: Heb. lights of the light in heauen.

26.32.9.text: Heb. prouoke to anger, or griefe.

26.32.15.text: Heb. desolate from the fulnesse therof.

26.32.27.text: Hebr. with weapons of their warre.

26.33.31.text: Hebr. according to the comming of the people.

26.34.5.text: Or, without a shepheard: and so verse 8.

26.34.17.text: Heb. small cattell of lambes and kids.

26.35.10.text: Or, though the Lord was there.

26.36.3.text: Or, ye are made to come vp on the lip of the tongue.

26.39.2.text: Or, strike thee with sixe plagues
Or, drawe thee backe, with an book of six teeth, as chap. 38. 4.
Heb. the sides of the North.

26.39.5.text: Hebr. the face of the field.

26.39.9.text: Or, make a fire of them.

26.39.11.text: That is, the multitude of Gog.

26.39.17.text: Heb. to the foule of euery wing.

26.39.28.text: Hebr. by my causing of them &c.

26.40.6.text: Heb. whose face was the way toward the East.

26.40.43.text: Or, andirons or the two harthstones.

26.40.45.text: Or, ward: or, ordinance, and so ver. 46.

26.41.6.text: Or, three and thirty times, or foot.

26.41.7.text: Heb. it was made broader and went round.

26.41.16.text: Or, and the ground vnto the windowes.

26.42.5.text: Or, and the building consisted of the lower and the middle-most.

26.43.3.text: Or, when I came to prophecie that the citie should be destroyed. See chap.9. 2,5.

26.43.8.text: Or, for there was but a wall betweene me and them.

26.43.15.text: Heb. Marel, that is, the Mountaine of God.
Hebr. Ariel, that is, the Lyon of God.

26.44.8.text: Or, ward, or ordinance. And so verse 14. and 16.

26.44.12.text: Heb. were for a stumbling blocke of iniquitie vnto &c.

26.44.18.text: Or, in sweating places. Heb. in, or with sweat.

26.45.1.text: Heb. when yee cause the land to fall.

26.46.5.text: Hebr. the gift of his hand.

26.46.21.text: Heb. a court in a corner of a court, and a court in a corner of a court.

26.47.11.text: Or, and that which shall not be healed.

26.48.11.text: Or, the sanctified portion shall be for the priests.

27.1.5.text: Hebr. the wine of his drinke.

27.2.18.text: Or, that they should not destroy Daniel, &c.

27.2.25.text: Cald. children of the captiuitie of Iudah.

27.2.34.text: Or, which was not in hands. As verse 45.

27.2.45.text: Or, which was not in hand.

27.3.12.text: Cald. haue set no regard vpon thee.

27.3.25.text: Cal. there is no hurt in them.

27.3.29.text: Cald. a decree is made by me.

27.4.2.text: Cald. it was seemely before me.

27.4.27.text: Or, an healing of thine errour.

27.5.6.text: Or, girdles. Cald. bindings or knots.

27.5.21.text: Or, hee made his heart equall, &c.

27.5.31.text: Cald. he as the Sonne of, &c.
